I only read the first 100 pages, but it sounds like the last 100 are so terribly written they might as well be written by a  different author entirely. I think the physics of the watch were revealed a bit last minute, and it could have benefited from foreshadowing during his earlier encounters. I'm sure they could have incorporated it if they really tried, but it's not needed or anything. Also for some reason, the ending is surprisingly great! Most hentai have the same ending you've seen a million times before, where the guy goes on to rape more and more people, never facing justice. This hentai, however, breaks the mold by letting his final (on-screen, anyway) victim get in one last hit, which breaks his watch, trapping him in the time-stopped world! It would be nice to know a bit more about what both him and the woman did during the extended time-stop, but sometimes leaving a bit up to the imagination is a good thing! Overall, solid 8/10 hentai, and an easy 9/10 plot!
